quest.name: A Dainty Dilemma
journal: Jacke appears eager to give you your first assignment.

Jacke has assigned you your first official task─a case concerning a plundered piece of imperial technology. Another rogue, a Lalafell by the name of Perimu Haurimu, is to assist you in your work. Speak with Perimu “Underfoot” Haurimu to begin your assignment.

Before you start your task in earnest, Perimu wishes to impress upon you the importance of evasion for a lightly armored rogue. Head out to lower La Noscea and defeat three aureliae while focusing on avoiding attacks through the use of swift footwork.
You have defeated the aureliae. Return to the Rogues' Guild and report to Perimu Haurimu.

You make your report, and Perimu Haurimu appears satisfied with your skills of evasion. After explaining that the first step in your assignment is to locate the thugs who violated the code, Underfoot then suggests making use of the guild's widespread spy network. Head to the Drowning Wench and attempt to order a weak ale from I'tolwann, the Miqo'te server.

You make your incredibly un-Lominsan-like order for weak ale, signalling to I'tolwann that you are a member of the Rogues' Guild in search of information. The Drowning Wench server then provides you with a description of your targets, otherwise known as the “Dainty Demolishers.” It seems the Demolishers are known for fencing their goods─mostly pieces of stolen Garlean machinery─to a group of goblins in middle La Noscea. Travel to Summerford, and join with Perimu Haurimu at his vantage point across the river from the beastmen's camp.
After rendezvousing with Perimu, you learn that one of the beastmen is already in possession of the stolen goods. Defeat the goblin gambler, and retrieve the firing mechanism.
You have slain the goblin gambler and secured the magitek device. Return to Perimu Haurimu at his vantage point and confirm that you have retrieved the correct gadget.
Perimu Haurimu inspects the device and commends you on a job well done. Return to the Rogues' Guild and deliver the firing mechanism to Jacke.

After delivering the device to Jacke, the “Dutiful Sisters” are suddenly paid a visit by the Dainty Demolishers. It seems the trio of dandified thugs had trailed you back to the guild with the intent of demanding restitution for your recent act of larceny. The rogues make short work of the intruders, but not before the Demolishers' leader reveals a curious fact about the guild's past. Speak with Jacke to conclude your assignment and learn more about the history of the rogues.

Though reluctant to dwell on past events, Jacke nevertheless explains to you the origin of the Rogues' Guild. No matter how its name changes, the guildmaster insists that the guild's task of upholding the code ever remains the same. Return to your training and prepare for your next assignment.

※The next rogue quest will be available from Jacke upon reaching level 10.
objectives: Report to Perimu Haurimu at the Rogues' Guild.
Speak with I'tolwann at the Drowning Wench.
Speak with Perimu Haurimu in Summerford.
Steal the firing mechanism #43 from a goblin gambler.
Present the firing mechanism #43 to Perimu Haurimu.
Deliver the firing mechanism #43 to Jacke at the Rogues' Guild.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ho there, Forename. I must say, yer lookin' comfortable enough with those stabbers o' yers.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Aye, I reckon yer good an' ready for yer first assignment.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: ...Ordinarily I'd stow me whids an' let ye get on with yer work, but seein' as we only just dragged ye into the shadows, there might be a couple things what ye ain't yet familiar with.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Let's build on what ye likely do know. An' that's the fact that the Admiral─gods bless her soul─has outlawed piracy in Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: So, why do ye think there're still so many soddin' pirates in this town? I'll tell ye why: it's 'cause there's still one way for 'em to loot an' pillage without incurrin' the wrath o' the law.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: All ye need do is apply to serve the thalassocracy as a “certified privateer.” A captain with a privateer's license is free to terrorize the seas till the aldgoats come home...so long as he only targets vessels what belong to the Garlean Empire.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: 'Course, considerin' how bloody vast the Empire is, that's plenty o' lootin' to go around.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Crews fill their holds with imperial plunder, then sail back here to Limsa to off-load the spoils. ...An' that's where this particular case went sour.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: See, this one crew got their fambles on a magitek device─a firin' mechanism to be precise─but was rooked out o' their haul by some heavy-handed coves.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: If ye'll recall, that don't sit well with the code. If yer bold enough to rook a pirate out o' his due, then ye'd best be prepared for a visit from the rogues.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ah, an' speakin' o' visitin' rogues... Underfoot! Over here, lad!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I want the pair o' ye workin' together on this. Pass sentence on them code-defyin' rooks, and bite back that magitek part.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Eh!? What's the lasscolt need me for!?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Yer in charge o' new recruits, ain't ye? It's Forename's first assignment─yer to go along an' give herhim the benefit o' yer wisdom.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Since when was I in charge o' new─ Ah, bugger it...

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Er... So I guess we're to be partners for the now. The name's Perimu Haurimu, but most o' me fellows call me “Underfoot.”

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: He might seem a touch reluctant, but Perimu's one of our best. You just do as he says, an' ye'll get the job done.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: All right, then, me young rogue. Seein' as this is yer first official outin', I want to be sure yer dance steps are up to the task.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: With them shortblades, ye need to get in good an' close to yer mark, aye? But we ain't bleedin' swads in shinin' armor, an' the lighter kit we wear ain't much protection from a click to the gan.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: So if ye don't fancy spittin' blood an' teeth, yer best defense is simply not bein' there when yer mark winds up to land a nasty clout.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Slidin' 'round to a flank usually does the trick, but there's some rum fun every rogue should master: the shade shift. Clear yer mind an' trust in yer speed, an' ye can leave an axe-wieldin' brute or spell-flingin' mage chasin' yer shadow while ye bury yer stabbers in his guts.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Right, now it's time ye put this lesson into practice against some o' those aureliae out in lower La Noscea. I hope ye was payin' attention, lasslad, 'cause those tentacles can pack a wallop. Enjoy!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Head out into lower La Noscea an' pick a fight with a few o' them aureliae. Remember: the point o' this exercise is to practice yer evasion, so don't come back to me with welts all over yer face!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Done with yer practice, then? Heh heh, the sting o' them tentacled buggers'll soon teach ye to stay on yer toes, eh?

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Ahem. Now we've got yer blood rushin', I'd say it's time to get down to work.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: First things first, we need to track down them addled coves what rooked that magitek gadget.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Might be as one of our rogues has heard somethin'. The guild thrives on information, ye see, an' we've agents scattered far an' wide with their glazes keen an' their wattles to the ground.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Let's pay us a visit to I'tolwann at the Drownin' Wench. Ask her for a weak ale, an' see what that gets ye.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: I'm not settin' ye up for a laugh, lasslad. Trust me!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Order yerself a weak ale. It'll all make sense in a bit.

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: Welcome to the Drowning Wench! What's your pleasure, misssir?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you order?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: A chilled ale.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: A strong ale.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: A weak ale.

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: Certainly, misssir. Take a seat, and I'll bring it straight to your─ Hm? Changed your mind?

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: Never in all my days! We may serve some cheap grog in the Wench, but naught that was watered down.

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: If our usual ale is too bold for your taste, mayhaps you'd like to order from the underground menu?

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: Aye, there's quite a lot on offer for a customer with your roguish charms. Was there something in particular I could help you with?

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: ...Ah, the trouble over that magitek loot? 'Twas not a subtle job.

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: The gang in question is an unusual group of former pirates calling themselves the “Dainty Demolishers.” They seem to be enamored of court dandy mannerisms, and have a preference for seizing Garlean machinery.

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: They're also known for conspiring with goblins. Rumors say that the Demolishers visit a beastman camp in middle La Noscea to fence their goods.

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: And those goods generally take the form of imperial technology─I imagine the goblins were rather pleased to take possession of a Mark XLIII anti-aircraft cannon firing mechanism.

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: If you mean to steal the device back, then your trail leads to the goblin camp in Summerford.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Summerford, eh? On yer way, lasslad. Meet me across the river from the camp an' we'll plan our next move...

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: That twice-stolen magitek device is likely at the goblin camp in Summerford. I'd be quick if I were you─it won't be long before those curious beastmen begin taking it to pieces.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Get yer noggin down, Forename. I've been snilchin' the action across the way there.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: No sign o' the Demolishers, but I did see one o' them gambler coves stuffin' the Garlean gadget into his backpack.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: I knew I'tolwann would steer us aright. This is yer chance, lasslad─clout that gambler gobbie an' grabble that device!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Er... I've lost track o' which gob it was, but I'm thinkin' it's that sod on the left. Just make sure ye dance away from any bomb blasts─twistin' an' dodgin' in the middle of a fireball might not save ye from gettin' yer eyebrows singed off.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Go on, then─that gambler ain't gonna wait all day. Show ol' Underfoot how ye've learned yer lessons!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: That's the way, lasslad. There was naught for me to do but sit on me daddles an' watch! ...So, ye've got the goods, then?

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Aye, this is the device, an' no mistakin'.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Let's get it back to the guild, eh? We still owe them Demolisher bastards a millin', but they'll keep for the now.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Here, you should be the one to deliver the prize to Jacke. It was yer hand what snatched it outta the goblins' paws, after all.

dialogue.name: KOBUNA00110
dialogue.text: Captain! Captain, I say! Some fiend has perpetrated violence upon our goblin colleagues whilst we sought but to wet our throats with fine libations!

dialogue.name: KOBUNB00110
dialogue.text: This will not stand, Captain! Our finely filched loot has been pilfered from under our noses!

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: Blast and bother! My blood boils and bubbles at the temerity of this affront!

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: I know not the identity of these audacious buffoons, but they shall be made to pay and pay dearly! With me, my fine fellows!

dialogue.name: KOBUNAB00110
dialogue.text: (-Dainty Demolisher Deckhands-)Huzzah!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Hand that magitek gadget directly to Jacke─I ain't about to take credit for yer fieldwork!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ye manage to grabble that firin' mechanism yet, Forename?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ah, still in one piece, too!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ye've done well for yer first assignment, lasslad. It don't look like much, but that crew put their lives on the line to cloy this here bauble. They'll be pleased to see it snatched back from the ruffmans.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: We've yet to do for the Dainty Demolishers, Jacke... The job ain't over.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Yer right, Underfoot. It ain't. Ye break the code, ye face the consequences.

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: (-???-)Oho! This is not at all what I expected from the inside of a convent!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: ...An' who might you be, sirs?

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: Hahaha! Your ignorance is understandable! After all, our schemes are always perfect─our heists, impeccable! Shall I reveal our infamous name and drink in your delicious terror?

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: We are deadly, dastardly, and dictionally devilish! Quail before the Dainty Demolishers!

dialogue.name: KOBUNA00110
dialogue.text: Captain! Captain, I say! There's the lousecad who misappropriated our merchandise!

dialogue.name: KOBUNB00110
dialogue.text: I concur! SheHe is the selfsame simpleton whom we trailed unnoticed to this very establishment!

dialogue.name: KOBUNAB00110
dialogue.text: (-Dainty Demolisher Deckhands-)Surprise, surprise!

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: Now, now, my dear dandies. Let us not be unpleasant. We should endeavor to resolve this distastefulness without resorting to insults or other less...diplomatic methods. At least not yet.

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: You there. Yes, the clean-cheeked errand boy. Be a good fellow, and fetch me your superior.

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: One of your colleagues has committed a terrible crime against us. And we shall not be leaving until the proper restitution has been paid.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: ...Oho, an errand boy now, am I?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Tell me, Captain: just what kind o' place do ye think this is, then?

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: Hm? This place? Why, I suppose it is some manner of convent. The one-eyed doorman named it the “Dutiful Sisters of the Edelweiss,” or some such...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: An ye've yet to realize yer mistake? Yer fate was sealed the moment ye dragged yer sorry quarron across the threshold.

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: ...Are you threatening me, boy!? I'll have my fellows cut out that impudent tongue!

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: We've exhausted our reserves of “dainty” today, lads! Show these fraudulent “Sisters” how the Demolishers deal with upstarts!

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: (-Red-haired Rogue-)Ye still don't understand, do ye?

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: (-Red-haired Rogue-)There are but three sorts o' culls what the doorman'll let pass: clients, recruits─

dialogue.name: KOBUNB00110
dialogue.text: Gods spit!

dialogue.name: KOBUNB00110
dialogue.text: I'll kill you all!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Didn't yer mum teach ye not to interrupt a lady when she's talkin'?

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Ye'd have learned that the third sort o' cull is a bollocks-for-brains mark what marches himself right into the rogues' den.

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: R-Rogues!? B-But...we were so careful!

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: I'd heard tales in my pirate days─stories about the merciless wraiths who uphold the code. They weren't called rogues back then, though...

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: The “Upright Thieves,” they were! The knives in the shadows!

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: Y-You can't be them... You're just trying to scare me! Well, the captain of the Dainty Demolishers is not so easily cowed!

dialogue.name: OYABUN00110
dialogue.text: To the hells with your deceptions! Huzzah! Huzzah for my fallen comrades!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Deceptions? Aye. Anyone ye meet could be a rogue, Captain─even a clean-cheeked errand boy.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: He's still breathin'. Find some rope an' string him up someplace in town.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: An' now the job's done. Quite an introduction ye had there, eh?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Welcome to Limsa Lominsa's ever-churnin' underbelly, where the thieves shed their skins an' became rogues.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I'm not much for discussin' the old days, but since it's come up I might as well clear up the confusion.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: It was back when piracy was at its peak. The coves what protected the code were dimber dambers─the best lads an' lasses to be had from among the pirate crews.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: They bit back the goods what was wrongly bitten, an' came for the guilty under cover of darkmans. “Upright Thief” became the title for these coves what dealt in sanctioned stealin' an' millin'.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: But it was only those as had cut all ties with the buccaneer's life what was accepted into the ranks. Conflictin' loyalties, an' all that.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: They formed their own guild an' even their own way o' speakin', an' what was once pirates was pirates no more.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Later on, when Merlwyb took the Admiral's chair, the Upright Thieves agreed to abide by her laws.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: We became the “Rogues' Guild” to mark the change, an' altered our recruitin' policy to accept 'venturers like yerself. But although the title is different, the job remains the same: uphold the code, an' preserve the underground society what spawned us.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: ...Just as ye've done with this assignment. Keep up the good work, Forename, an' ye'll go far in the shadows!
